item.title: Error rate vs Fidelity (Part 1): Unveil the mathematics behind quantum error rate
item.description: In the article of Bernsterin-Vazirani implementation, I’ve addressed one of the most crucial challenges of quantum computing. The field is yet to flourish because quantum gates aren’t constructed to be good enough. One major difference of quantum gates versus classical counterparts is that quantum gates have to be reversible, which means we can retrieve a prior state of a qubit without loss of information. Scientists are now on their way to establish a proper scheme for building decent quantum gates.
